intro: Leichhardtia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed leichhardtia, is a herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or pink flowers during the spring. Leichhardtia stenophylla is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
